You're correct, it's not currently supported. If you want to add support
fo=
r it, you should make changes against the version on github that I'm
curren=
tly working on ( https://github.com/OliverColeman/ahni ). I wouldn't
recomm=
end trying to extend the GridNet neural network, it's clunky enough
with ju=
st 2D layers (6 dimensional weight arrays aren't good for
performance). Ins=
tead I would recommend modifying or extending the BainNN
and HyperNEATTrans=
criberBain classes to support 3+D layers (this would also
require extending=
 the API for a couple of interface classes). Ideally N
dimensional layers w=
ould be supported, if you're keen. If you're interested
I can provide more =
details (off this list).

On 3 October 2012 09:29, shaungeek0101 <shaun.lus=
k@...> wrote:

> **
>
>
> How does one setup 3+ dimensional inputs us=
ing AHNI?
> I didn't see anything obvious in the config files or the exampl=
es provided
> as to how to do that.
> Looking at the code, I'm not certain =
it has this functionality in its
> current state. Is that something that ne=
eds to be added?
>
>  
>

--bcaec554dc1ae5dbe704cb1d10f6
Content-Type: text/html; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You're correct, it's not currently supported. If you want to add su=
pport for it, you should make changes against the version on github that I&=
#39;m currently working on (=A0<a href=3D"https://github.com/OliverColeman/=
ahni">https://github.com/OliverColeman/ahni</a>=A0). I wouldn't recomme=
nd trying to extend the GridNet neural network, it's clunky enough with=
 just 2D layers (6 dimensional weight arrays aren't good for performanc=
e). Instead I would recommend modifying or extending the BainNN and=A0Hyper=
NEATTranscriberBain classes to support 3+D layers (this would also require =
extending the API for a couple of interface classes). Ideally N dimensional=
 layers would be supported, if you're keen. If you're interested I =
can provide more details (off this list).<br>
